Topic.Title: Glenn Beck auctions and artwork, "Obama in Pee Pee"

Message.Msg: Hey it's a work of art. All the corrupt "libs" applauded the crucifix being in a jar of urine as wonderful. I think the Kenyan would look good dumped in an out house. It would be "art". I had a friend years ago that as a joke used "baby yellow" to paint a picture in his college art class. The professor oohed and aaahed over it. Shows you how they've corrupted art and turned it into something ugly. Picasso got a big kick out the liberal fools that paid high prices for his creations. He didn't think of it as "art" but a way of separating fools from their money. He actually was a good artist and painted many serious pieces.

Topic.Title: Romney was just wrong, 99% of americans are lazy and unproductive!

Message.Msg: If you run the same numbers on income growth from 1979 until 2010 instead of from 1979 until the market's peak in 2007, you get a result that is FAR more detrimental for the top 1% and far more beneficial for the bottom 99%. I'm not necessarily defending the top 1% and those people's responsibility for 38% of all personal, federal income tax revenues... ... I'm just saying that if you use a date range like that, the your readers should know that you couldn't have picked any date range over the past 40 years that would have made it look better for the top 1% nor worse for the bottom 99%... ... not one, single date range. S

Message.Title: Why does everybody talk about the budget over the next decade?

Topic.Title: Romney was just wrong, 99% of americans are lazy and unproductive!

Message.Msg: ... because the top 1% got HAMMERED between 2007 and 2010, that's why, and you're point was to justify increasing the percentage of tax revenues they provide from the current 38% to what Obama want's their share of them to be... 44%. Question: Do you think we should increase the percentage of americans that don't pay federal income tax from the current 48% of americans to 55 or 60% of Americans? If your answer is: "they pay FICA taxes so #$%$!"... then, do you think it was fair that when they reduced worker's FICA taxes from 6.2% to 4.2% that they should have ALSO reduced the "employers" portion of FICA taxes from 6.2% to 4.2% as well (which they didn't)? Given that 60% of American's surveyed don't even KNOW that employers pay FICA taxes... do you think it's fair that the 6.2% of wages that the employer is contributing should amount to essentially providing 60% of those American's future social security benefits given that the employers are currently paying 60% of each employee's FICA tax? Do you think employers would employ and wealthy people would remain americans if employers had to provide 75% of an employee's FICA taxes and the top 1% was made responsible for 60% of all personal federal income taxes?... ... just how much socialism, un-employment, and lack of capital spending do you WANT in America?... and at what point does our average living standard begin to drop as it has in 100% of all the other countries that hammered free-enterprise capitalism in this way over the past 75 years? S
